title: ADLight: A Universal Approach of Traffic Signal Control with Augmented Data Using Reinforcement Learning. (arXiv:2210.13378v2 [eess.SY] UPDATED)
abstract: Traffic signal control has the potential to reduce congestion in dynamic networks. Recent studies show that traffic signal control with reinforcement learning (RL) methods can significantly reduce the average waiting time. However, a shortcoming of existing methods is that they require model retraining for new intersections with different structures. In this paper, we propose a novel reinforcement learning approach with augmented data (ADLight) to train a universal model for intersections with different structures. We propose a new agent design incorporating features on movements and actions with set current phase duration to allow the generalized model to have the same structure for different intersections. A new data augmentation method named \textit{movement shuffle} is developed to improve the generalization performance. translated_abstract: 交通信号控制在动态网络中有着减少拥堵的潜力。最近的研究表明，使用强化学习方法进行交通信号控制可显著降低平均等待时间。然而，现有方法的一个缺点是，它们需要为具有不同结构的新交叉口重新训练模型。在本文中，我们提出了一种新颖的增强数据强化学习方法（ADLight），用于训练通用模型以适用于具有不同结构的交叉口。我们提出了一种新的智能体设计，将移动和动作特征与设置当前阶段持续时间相结合，以使通用模型对于不同交叉口具有相同的结构。开发了一种名为“运动洗牌”的新数据增强方法，以提高通用性能。我们还在模拟城市移动（SUMO）中测试了通用模型在新交叉口中的性能。结果表明，我们的方法的性能接近于最佳性能。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于强化学习和增强数据的通用交通信号控制方法ADLight，使用移动洗牌等方式改善了通用性能，可以适用于不同结构的交叉口，并在SUMO中得到了验证。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a universal traffic signal control method ADLight that uses reinforcement learning and augmented data, incorporating features on movements and actions to train a generalized model for intersections with different structures, and improves the generalization performance with a new data augmentation method named "movement shuffle". The approach is validated in SUMO and achieves performance close to the optimal.
